==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|し|ない|でん|しゃ|yomi=on}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=しないでんしゃ|市内|tr1=shinai|t1=within a city, intracity|電車|tr2=densha|t2=electric train}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
* {{ja-pron|しない でんしゃ|y=on}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|しない でんしゃ|kyu=市內電車}}

# a [[tram]], a [[streetcar]] (passenger vehicle)

====Usage notes====
Although the kanji literally just mean {{m|en|intracity}} ''(electric)'' {{m|en|train}}, in common usage, this term indicates an electric train running on city streets, i.e. a tram or streetcar.<ref name="KDJ"></ref>

====Derived terms====
* {{ja-r|市電|しでん}}

====Synonyms====
* {{ja-r|路面電車|ろめん でんしゃ}} {{qualifier|“streetcar”, but not explicitly “intracity”}}, {{ja-r|都電|とでん}}
